intro: Senra arabica, commonly known as Arabica coffee. It is a species of the Rubiaceae family, native to East Africa. The plant is an evergreen shrub that can grow up to 10 feet tall, with dark green, oval-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and white, followed by red berries containing two seeds, which are the coffee beans. The plant thrives in high altitudes, with moderate temperatures and high rainfall.
